actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to implement General Accounting Office recommendations regarding the use of commercial software to detect billing code abuse in medicare claims processing, and for other purposes.
short_title: Medicare Billing Abuse Prevention Act of 1995
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: Medicare Billing Abuse Prevention Act of 1995 - Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to require Medicare carriers to acquire commercial automatic data processing equipment (ADPE) meeting specified requirements to process Medicare part B (Supplementary Medical Insurance) claims for the purpose of identifying billing code abuse and implement such ADPE by a certain date. Provides for the disclosure of ADPE and related data under limited circumstances. Requires the Secretary to order a review of existing regulations, guidelines, and other guidance governing Medicare payment policies and billing code abuse to determine if revision is necessary to maximize the benefits resulting from the use of ADPE.

titles.title: Medicare Billing Abuse Prevention Act of 1995
A bill to implement General Accounting Office recommendations regarding the use of commercial software to detect billing code abuse in medicare claims processing, and for other purposes.
